note.body:
Yes, this requires a development version of libadwaita.

Can still be tested with flatpak on the gnome:master runtime, but for convenience it's probably better to wait for the official libadwaita-1.7 release.

I'll check the deprecated guards in the meanwhile, thanks for the review! :slight_smile:

Ghex 46.0 hangs when doing special copy Plain text (as space delimited hex pairs)

note.body:
I've just reproduced it following the description

1-load a file

2-select a zone

3-menu-\>edition-\>copy special and choose "Plain text (as space delimited hex pairs)"

the application hangs and after a while i'm proposed to force the application to quit.

here is what i get in logs

20:17:33 ghex: g_value_get_object: assertion 'G_VALUE_HOLDS_OBJECT (value)' failed 20:17:33 ghex: g_value_get_object: assertion 'G_VALUE_HOLDS_OBJECT (value)' failed 20:17:33 ghex: gdk_content_provider_get_value: assertion 'G_IS_VALUE (value)' failed 20:17:33 ghex: ../../../gobject/gvalue.c:104: cannot initialize GValue with type '(null)', this type has no GTypeValueTable implementation 20:17:33 ghex: can't peek value table for type '' which is not currently referenced 20:17:33 ghex: ../../../gobject/gtype.c:4393: type id '0' is invalid 20:17:33 ghex: g_once_init_leave_pointer: assertion 'result != 0' failed 20:17:33 ghex: cannot register existing type 'HexPasteData'

target_title: Ghex 46.0 hangs when doing special copy Plain text (as space delimited hex pairs)

note.body: I can't reproduce, so I think this needs additional information; a reproducer, a backtrace, or something.

target_title: Add copying as code feature

note.body:
I like the functionality in this MR, but have 2 issues with it. 1st (and easier to address) are the code style quibbles I have. See the inline comments I have provided. It should be correctable quite quickly.

The 2nd issue I have is: although we emit a `g_warning()` when copy-special-only operations are performed in the paste special dialog, they shouldn't show up there at all if they're not implemented. 

(That's not to say the `g_warning` is misplaced; indeed, if a *programmer* does the wrong thing, it should emit this runtime warning.)

It's been a long time since I looked at this part of the codebase in too much detail, but  I think you could potentially make this work by expanding the `KnownMimeType` data structure to allow for specifying whether copy-special, paste-special, or both, operations are permitted. This struct is private API and can be modified without breaking ABI.

Then, as we iterate through and add listbox entries for copy and paste operations, we can ensure they are only added if that action is permitted by the operation.

Thanks again for the MR - I think it's a cool feature and can definitely be merged if some of these issues are worked out!

target_title: Add copying as code feature

note.body: This `g_warning ()` call is not incorrect, but see my comments in the MR proper for my issue with the fact that *all* we do is emit a `g_warning` as opposed to addressing the issue that it shouldn't show up in the Paste Special dialog at all.

target_title: Add copying as code feature

note.body:
3 minor stylistic quibbles here:

(1) in glib/gnome ("g*") codebases, function pointer types are generally done in PascalCase. So something like `HexPasteDataCallback` would be more consistent with that style here.

(2) again, in g* codebases, we prefer the asterisk to be adjacent to the object as opposed to the type.

(3) in C, `()` in a function or function pointer declaration means it could take anything or nothing. So this should read as `(void)`.

So please consider rewriting this line to be something like:
`typedef char *(*HexPasteDataCallback) (void);`

target_title: Add copying as code feature

note.body: I don't believe we use C++ style comments elsewhere in the codebase, so this should be made a C-style comment (ie, `/* ... */`)
